profile.name: Jordan Harband
profile.bio: Software engineer & @TC39 delegate. Surgeon with git rebase. Diving deep into #AI, #Go, #Rust. Ex-@Coinbase, @Airbnb, @Twitter. Obsessed with ⸮ & petrichor.

tweets.content: Good API design isn't just about functionality; it's about ergonomics and developer experience. A technically perfect API that's a pain to use is still a failure. #APIDesign #DevEx
If your rebase isn't interactive, are you even *living*? Embrace the surgical precision. The history of your project deserves it. #git #devtools
Funny how many 'new' ideas in tech are just old ideas, re-packaged and re-branded with new tooling. The fundamentals remain, just the shiny wrapper changes. History repeats, even in software. 🔁
Are we *sure* we need another primitive for collection iteration, or is this just bikeshedding in disguise? Sometimes simplicity trumps theoretical completeness. ⸮ #JavaScript #TC39

Messing around with a Rust backend for a personal project. The compile times are a price worth paying for that type safety feeling. So far, so good. The borrow checker is my new best frenemy. ⸮ #Rust #backend
Current debugging state: Staring intensely at the screen, hoping the bug will feel my gaze and confess its sins. Any other techniques folks swear by ⸮ #debugging #devlife
Pushed a tiny but impactful fix to a module I use daily. It's amazing how much collective effort goes into the foundational tools we all rely on. #OpenSource #gratitude
Reflecting on my journey from @MobBase to @Airbnb, @Twitter, @Coinbase, and #TC39. It's been a wild ride of learning, building, and breaking. What a privilege to contribute. What's next ⸮
Huge news! CSS `has()` selector landing in stable soon. This is a bona fide game changer for component architecture and styling without JS. Prepare for cleaner markups! 🙌 #webdev #CSS
Spent the morning explaining async/await to a junior dev. Always a fun mental exercise to break down complex concepts simply. Any favorite analogies out there for JS concurrency?
My 'git rebase --abort' count for the day is already higher than my coffee intake. Send help. Or more coffee. #devlife #git
If you rely on open source, consider contributing back – even if it's just docs, bug reports, or a tiny PR. The ecosystem thrives on collective effort. It's not just for 'experts.' #OpenSource
That fresh scent of petrichor after the rain just hits different. Nature's way of reminding us of simple pleasures amidst the chaos of `npm install`. 🌧️

The pendulum swings. Today's 'elegant solution' is tomorrow's 'legacy burden.' It's just the cycle of software. The goal is to build something resilient enough to *become* legacy gracefully. #softwareengineering
Just spent an hour diving into the WebAssembly component model. My brain hurts but in a good way. The future of modularity is looking very interesting. #WebAssembly #WASM
Finished reviewing a Stage 2 proposal for #TC39 today. The devil truly is in the details when you're shaping the future of a language used by billions. Important work.

Unpopular opinion: Sometimes, for truly small, self-contained scripts, vanilla JS without TypeScript feels *more* productive. The overhead can occasionally outweigh the safety for quick hacks. Fight me. #TypeScript #JavaScript
Just sat through a meeting that absolutely, positively, 100% could have been an email. My brain cells are requesting a refund. #devlife #meetings
